metadata.title: CVE-2022-22737 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Constructing audio sinks could have lead to a race condition when playingaudio files and closing windows. This could have lead to a use-after-freecausing a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects FirefoxESR < 91.5, Firefox < 96, and Thunderbird < 91.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
